title: Littlewood-Offord problems for Ising models
abstract:
We consider the one dimensional Littlewood-Offord problem for general Ising
models. More precisely, consider the concentration function
\[Q_n(x,v)=P(\sum_{i=1}^{n}\varepsilon_iv_i\in(x-1,x+1)),\] where
$x\in\mathbb{R}$, $v_1,v_2,\ldots,v_n$ are real numbers such that $|v_1|\geq 1,
|v_2|\geq 1,\ldots, |v_n|\geq 1$, and $(\varepsilon_i)_{i=1,2,\ldots,n}$ are
spins of some Ising model. Let $Q_n=\sup_{x,v}Q_n(x,v)$. Under natural
assumptions, we show that there exists a universal constant $C$ such that for
all $n\geq 1$, \[\binom{n}{[n/2]}2^{-n}\leq Q_n\leq Cn^{-\frac{1}{2}}.\]
